Dr. David P. Bullis (Behavioral Medicine, Newton–Wellesley Hospital, Newton, MA): A 54-year-old man was evaluated by the neuropsychology service of this hospital because of irritability, confusion, and odd behaviors.
The patient had been in his usual state of health until 9 months before the current...
model_response: 1. **Analysis:** A 54-year-old man presents with new-onset cognitive decline, irritability, confusion, and odd behaviors following treatment for squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue with metastasis to cervical lymph nodes.  His treatment included surgery, radiation, and a sural nerve graft for post-operative neuropathy. He experienced a near-fatal methadone overdose, followed by septic shock, aspiration pneumonia, acute kidney injury, and delirium.  Neuropsychological testing revealed impaired ...
